com.cyc.kb

Interface Sentence

  • All Superinterfaces:
    KbObject, KbObject.KbObjectWithArity
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    SentenceWrapper

    public interface Sentence
extends KbObject.KbObjectWithArity
    The interface for Cyc sentences. Sentences encode propositions, which can be used as questions (in a Query) or claims (in an Assertion).
    Since:
    1.0

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface com.cyc.kb.KbObject

      • get

        static Sentence get(String sentStr)
             throws KbTypeException,
                    CreateException
        Attempts to convert a CycL string into a CycFormulaSentence and thus into a KbObject, Sentence. This static method wraps a call to SentenceService.get(java.lang.String); see that method's documentation for more details.
        Specified by:
        get in interface KbObject
        Parameters:
        sentStr - the string representing a Sentence in the KB, a CycL sentence
        Returns:
        a Sentence object
        Throws:
        KbTypeException
        CreateException - if the Sentence represented by sentStr could not be parsed.
        See Also:
        KbService.getKbObject(java.lang.String)

      • get

        static Sentence get(Relation pred,
                    Object... args)
             throws KbTypeException,

        Parameters:
        pred - the first argument of the formula
        args - the other arguments of the formula in the order they appear in the list
        Returns:
        a Sentence object
        Throws:
        KbTypeException - is thrown if the built cycObject is not a instance of CycFormulaSentence. This should never happen.
        CreateException

      • assertIn

        Assertion assertIn(Context ctx)
            throws KbException
        Assert this sentence in the context ctx. In many cases, it will be useful to call isAssertible(com.cyc.kb.Context) before asserting a sentence.
        Parameters:
        ctx - context where this sentence will be asserted
        Returns:
        the Assertion object, either a Fact or a Rule
        Throws:
        KbException - if the assertion fails for any reason, include being syntactically invalid

      • isAssertible

        boolean isAssertible(Context ctx)
        Checks if a given sentence meets the constraints necessary to be assertible in ctx. In particular, returns true if the arguments of the sentence are compatible with the argument constraints of the operator (i.e. could be made to actually meet the constraints without removing any existing assertions). For sentences with predicate operators, the arguments must also be compatible with all relevant interArg* constraints. In some cases, additional requirements are imposed (e.g. the constraints must actually be known to be met, not just not be known to be incompatible). For an explanation of why a particular sentence is not assertible, check notAssertibleExplanation(com.cyc.kb.Context)
        Parameters:
        ctx - the context where semantic constraints are checked
        Returns:
        whether the sentence is compatible with all relevant syntactic and semantic constraints, and is therefore assertible
        Throws:
        CycApiException - if unable to determine whether constraints are met

      • notAssertibleExplanation

        String notAssertibleExplanation(Context ctx)
        Return an explanation of why the sentence is not assertible. Note that this reason may not be exhaustive; once the problems mentioned in the reason are fixed, additional calls to this method may turn up additional problems.
        Parameters:
        ctx - context where semantic constraints are checked
        Returns:
        a detailed explanation of why a sentence is not assertible. Returns null if it encounters an internal error.

      • getVariables

        List<Variable> getVariables(boolean includeQueryable)
                     throws KbException
        Returns a list of the Variables in the sentence. Note that this is a copy of the variables, and modification of the returned value will not result in modifications of the Sentence.
        Parameters:
        includeQueryable - should this return the variables for which aquery would return bindings, or all free variables?
        Returns:
        a list of the variables in this sentence.
        Throws:
        KbException
        See Also:
        QuerySpecification.getQueryVariables()

      • getIndexicals

        List<KbObject> getIndexicals(boolean includeAllIndexicals)
                      throws KbException,
                             SessionCommunicationException
        Returns any #$IndexicalConcepts within the sentence. This method takes a boolean argument (includeAllIndexicals) which specifies whether it should return all of the indexical terms within the Sentence, or only those terms which must be resolved by the application. In other words, automatically-resolvable indexicals such as #$Now-Indexical will only be returned by this method if includeAllIndexicals is true.

        For a brief overview of indexicals, see KbObject.isIndexical().

        Parameters:
        includeAllIndexicals - whether to include all indexicals, or only those which must be resolved by the application
        Returns:
        the indexicals within the sentence
        Throws:
        KbException
        SessionCommunicationException
        See Also:
        KbObject.isIndexical(), getIndexicals(), replaceTerms(java.util.Map), QuerySpecification.getUnresolvedIndexicals(), com.cyc.query.QuerySpecification#setSubstitutions(java.util.Map), com.cyc.query.QuerySpecification#addSubstitutions(java.util.Map), QuerySpecification.getSubstitutions()

      • getIndexicals

        List<KbObject> getIndexicals()
                      throws KbException,
                             SessionCommunicationException
        Returns any #$IndexicalConcepts within the sentence which cannot be automatically resolved by Cyc. For example, #$Now-Indexical would not be included in the results (because Cyc can automatically resolve it to the current time) but a term like (TheNamedFn InformationStore "data source") would be included, because Cyc has no rules to resolve such a term. In other words, this method is the equivalent of passing false to getIndexicals(boolean).

        For a brief overview of indexicals, see KbObject.isIndexical().

        Returns:
        a list of all indexicals which will not be automatically resolved by Cyc
        Throws:
        KbException
        SessionCommunicationException

      • replaceTerms

        Sentence replaceTerms(Map substitutions)
               throws KbTypeException,
                      CreateException
        Non-destructively replace a set of objects within a Sentence. This does not modify the original Sentence, but instead returns a new one. To replace terms in a Query sentence, use com.cyc.query.QuerySpecification#setSubstitutions(java.util.Map) instead.

        Note: a common use of this method is to replace indexical terms, particularly in Query sentences, so you may want to see KbObject.isIndexical() for more details about them. However, this method can be used to replace any KbObjects within a Sentence, not just indexicals.

        Parameters:
        substitutions - the replacement mapping
        Returns:
        a new Sentence with the replaced terms
        Throws:
        KbTypeException
        CreateException
        See Also:
        replaceTerms(java.util.List, java.util.List)

      • replaceTerms

        Sentence replaceTerms(List<Object> from,
                      List<Object> to)
               throws KbTypeException,
                      CreateException
        For each element of from replace it with the element of to that's at the same index. This does not modify the original Sentence, but instead returns a new one.
        Parameters:
        from - a list of objects that will be replaced if found
        to - a list of objects that will be in the new modified sentence
        Returns:
        a new Sentence with the replaced terms
        Throws:
        KbTypeException
        CreateException
        See Also:
        replaceTerms(java.util.Map)

      • isValid

        Boolean isValid()
        Returns true if all of terms in the Sentence are valid per KbTerm.isValid().
        Returns:
        false if the KB object behind this object has been deleted or otherwise rendered invalid on the Cyc server. Returns true otherwise
